conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid from containers A, B, C, and D to determine whether each will end up in container E or F.
The first image shows the initial setup with labeled points A, B, C, D at the top and E, F at the bottom.
The second and third images show the actual liquid flow paths with colored streams.
Starting from the green container at the top left (A).
In the flow images, the green liquid flows downward.
The green liquid follows a path where it connects with the yellow bar.
Following the path downward, the green liquid combines with other streams.
The green liquid flows into the left container (E, purple).
Starting from the orange container (second from left, B).
The orange liquid flows downward and connects with the yellow bar.
The orange liquid follows a similar path to the green liquid.
The orange liquid flows into the left container (E, purple).
Starting from the light green/mint container (third from left, C).
The light green liquid flows downward and interacts with the orange horizontal bar.
Following its path through the system of baffles.
The light green liquid ultimately flows into the right container (F, yellow).
Starting from the blue container at the right (D).
The blue liquid flows downward in a somewhat curved path.
The blue liquid follows along the right edge of the board.
The blue liquid clearly flows into the right container (F, yellow).
Liquid from container A (green) flows into container E.
Liquid from container B (orange) flows into container E.
Liquid from container C (light green/mint) flows into container F.
Liquid from container D (blue) flows into container F.
